page.title: 15Ledburn
page.content: Ledburn, in the parish of Mentmore, consists of 33 dwellings on either side of a through road. These include 2 timbered houses, several cottages, an 1895 terrace of 4 farm labourers' houses, 4 modern bungalows, 3 detatched and 4 semi-detatched houses and a Queen Anne manor. Apart from a public house, a 'phone and a post box, residents have to travel 3 miles for all amenities. Milk and papers can be collected daily from a central point. The bus calls twice a week. Less than half the residents are local people though more than half the working population work in nearby towns. The proposed{Leighton Buzzard ring road,} though causing villagers a big detour, will reduce the speeding traffic, the main cause for concern amongst the villagers of an otherwise peaceful hamlet.
